title: Engineering Manager, Banking as a Service
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe builds economic infrastructure for the internet. We’re moving beyond payments and “up the stack” to help our users run their businesses more effectively. Issuing is developing APIs and full stack offering to empower businesses to launch physical and virtual card programs. We aim to help businesses deploy novel use cases that rely on fully programmable funds management instruments.
You can read more here:

Product pages: Issuing & Treasury
Recent News:

Stripe launches charge card program for Stripe Issuing
Stripe Issuing launches in Europe


 
What you’ll do
We’re looking for a seasoned engineering manager to lead the Funding and Billing team. You’ll be responsible for expanding and developing the team. You’ll drive pillar vision and roadmap. You’ll lead our coordination with product teams, operations teams, and other engineering teams at Stripe. We’re looking for a leader with a strong background in building scalable products; we need someone who is comfortable in a fast-moving environment with lots of moving pieces. 
Issuing is one of Stripe’s biggest bets. The right leaders will allow us to scale faster and more reliably as our business accelerates. If that sounds exciting, we’d love to speak with you.
Responsibilities

Be actively involved in strategic direction, product decisions, roadmap shaping for an emerging business
Iterate rapidly on features, tooling, and processes as we launch first versions of new products
Driving technical direction to work through tech stack evolutions
Work closely with our users and financial partners on a daily basis
Design, build, and maintain APIs, user-facing experiences, services, and systems
Make and adapt prioritization and staffing decisions as the team, business, and user demands progress.
Engineer solutions across systems such as core money-movement infrastructure, data pipelines, banking systems, and more
Grow, develop, recruit, and hire for an amazing team of engineers

 
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

You have built new, diverse teams to tackle challenging technical problems
You have at least 3 years of engineering management experience and 8 years of overall software development experience
You thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts

Preferred qualifications

You think of yourself as entrepreneurial and enjoy moving quickly on new, green-field products
You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems
You enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise. Almost every role at Stripe collaborates with some engineers, from Sales and Support in sharing feedback from our customers, to Legal and Accounting in supporting our systems for tracking money movement and reporting around the world

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
